tweets.text:
The destruction of England's waterways - by over extracting water and routinely dumping raw sewage - and the @EnvAgency's complicity in it is one of the great untold scandals.

We at @GoodLawProject are putting together a formidable team to take this on.
https://t.co/Q4gCrffC2j

@loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA It‚Äôs rained all day in Wales and the ground is saturated, what did you think was going to happen? Stop moaning about Dave and the EA and take some responsibility yourself - you‚Äôre a grown up.
‚ö†Ô∏è There are 3 x flood warnings in place in Devon: Rivers Tamar, Teign and Torridge. Check your flood risk https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/vXtUU5xoQj

Lovely on Falcon Meadow in Ditchingham,  Norfolk this morning @BungayTown @EnvAgency @BBJournal24 @ChrisPage90 @UKWX_ @OfficialWXUK @bbcweather @itvweather @GavinPartridge @EDP24 https://t.co/0i9rwPGHrD

There are a number of #flood alerts & warnings in place across the #Midlands & with more rain forecast over the weekend make sure you stay #floodaware. Keep up to date with the latest flood warnings at https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/QWPSdFeJhH

There are currently 9 flood alerts - the lowest level - and 1 flood warning in place for Cumbria.
The @EnvAgency says it's 'not expecting any widespread flooding across communities' though. https://t.co/G6fe0abtiw

Tankering sewage around is cheaper than sorting out the causes and the failed sewage system @thameswater  The @EnvAgency and @ofwat condone it so the customer and environment take the hit @sandralaville @GeorgeMonbiot @robertcourts  This was a delivery TO Eynsham Oxon today. https://t.co/VTX0ALbYf1

tweets.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è There are 4 x flood warnings in place across Devon due to heavy rain overnight causing river levels to rise on rivers Lyd, Tamar, Teign and Torridge. Be prepared. Sign up for flood warnings https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/llcjtuau2s

With a number of flood alerts and warning still live across Cumbria, we are looking at an improving picture as the weekend progresses. 
Check your risk: https://t.co/MnM00fqClF and make sure you know what each level of warning means for you
Be #floodaware https://t.co/VP0s5gXMDN

@loosecollie @Wyefarm @bentd76 @EnvAgency It is true our models are struggling with the events we‚Äôre getting on both the Severn & Wye recently. We are recalibrating them in light of new data.

We hadn‚Äôt seen a 5m flood at Hereford for nearly 20 years, we‚Äôve now had 3 in 18 months.
@MichaelJP1986 @EnvAgency Even though its been proven that dredging doesn't actually reduce flood risk? Seems like that prosecution wouldn't really go anywhere.....

@DaveThroupEA @Wyefarm @bentd76 @EnvAgency Rainfall in Herefordshire rarely sets the tone. South wye water is gone, it's Welsh water that affects the levels so dramatically.
Needs another dam upstream or we will say goodbye to the Old Bridge in Hereford I think.

@Wyefarm @bentd76 @loosecollie @EnvAgency Not until we‚Äôve got an actual peak at Builth. Until then it‚Äôs all based on predicted rainfall and is often subject to significant change.

We provide the best info we have at the time.

Wind will drive tidal surges this #halfterm W/E

Check weather & tide before heading out @metoffice 

https://t.co/vCPPKuDl34

Always watch the sea state

Know exit points on a beach 

‚Ä¢ Stay Back 

‚Ä¢ Take a phone 

‚Ä¢ Make it Home 

@EnvAgencySW @RNLI

https://t.co/ZIdSMIZyXX

tweets.text:
@loosecollie @EnvAgency Are you signed up to receive flood alerts as well as warnings?

The flood alert issued for the Wye in Herefordshire at 10am had predicted peaks & timings for Mordiford & Ross.
@bentd76 @loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA They've increased the maximum height at Ross by a metre!!! Surely the modeling would have been more accurate than that.

As the Chair of the @EnvAgency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. Catch up now with this week's episode with @EmmaHowardBoyd and @MLiebreich üåç

urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK‚Äôs Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.
